document.author: Raman Tehlan
document.title: Official Page of Raman Tehlan | Hello World!
document.keywords: Raman Tehlan ramantehlan Programmer Developer Designer Entrepreneur Resume CV.
document.description: Welcome to the official page of Raman Tehlan, here you can get all the information about him and have a close look at his vision for this world.

home.title: Hello World!
home.body:
Welcome to the official page of Raman Tehlan, here you can get all the information about me, use above menu to get details of a particular domain and if you are looking for a summary then you can check out my resume.

Regards,
Raman Tehlan

profile.name: Raman Tehlan
profile.vision: FOSS enthusiast, Just show me the code, love to attend hackathons and startup weekends, Fan of GNU/Linux, UI/UX and good Engineering, Also a visionary.

work.name: Cashfog
work.about:
An easy and smart service to maintain business transactions and documents online with analytics tools which provide more clear vision on cash flow.
  • Worked on powerful analytics tools to visualize all the business data.
  • Drag and drop document upload for all the important documents and files.
  • Beautiful UI/UX, with different modes for day and night.

work.name: AlvisAi
work.about:
A social network app with a built-in bot and AI. This AI can understand user 's feelings by processing their online posts and behavior.
  • Anonymous update with features to include emotions.
  • Ranking system for users which increase as a user do more activities.
  • Beautiful UI / UX with many features like add background image or a solid colour.

work.name: MS Printing & Packaging CO
work.about:
I was responsible for branding and online presence, also for creating formats of various documents like ledgers, purchase order etc.
  • Created ledgers in Excel sheets to decrease the use of paper.
  • Worked on company 's website and displayed business on the Google search.
  • Created formats for various documents like purchase orders,quotations etc.

projects.name: DataStructures-CPP
projects.about:
DataStructures-CPP is an application to implement data structures and algorithms in C++ using a menu-driven interface.
  • Created Source file for all the popular data structures.
  • Neat application structure for beginners and professionals to understand.
  • The program can be easily converted into other programming languages.

projects.name: Genetic-Tetris-Ai
projects.about:
An implementation of Genetic Algorithms to create evolving/mutating AI to play Tetris. Genetic Algorithms follow the principles first laid down by Charles Darwin of 'survival of the fittest.'
  • It uses matrix to create the game of Tetris.
  • Multiple speeds and ranking system for gameplay.
  • Simple yet beautiful UI / UX with user driven actions.

projects.name: Alexandrite
projects.about:
Alexandrite is an android app, which saves data on a device, whether it's temporary files, downloaded app assets, user media, structured data, or something else .
  • Worked on data storage provided by a device on Android.
  • Automated multiple processes.
  • Beautiful UI / UX with a smooth design.

projects.title: Hackathon - HACKRUPT
projects.about: Finojo is a decentralized tracking application of financial assets. It uses IPFS and Blockchain to allow corporate users to store there user files, documents, contracts, records etc on a decentralized network. Each Corporation and the user is provided with a unique finojo code, this code is used as a digital stamp for generating financial assets, later this code can be used to retrieve any file from the decentralized network.

projects.title: World Virtual Govhack
projects.about: Spero is an open source decentralized job marketplace for refugees, asylums, NGOs and governments. we leverage blockchain and artificial intelligence to connected about 65.6 million refugees to jobs around the world. This project was created in December 2017 for the biggest Global Virtual GovHack hackathon organized by UAE Government in 2017.

projects.title: Startup weekend by Techstars
projects.about:
Celer helps businesses to distribute their processing across the devices connected to the Internet.
  • Web app to get the processing from business users and API for app developers to integrate in there app.
  • API use 20 % -30 % of total available processing power.
  • Web app for app developers to see the processing they provided from there user base and get compensated for it(They are asked to remove ads or make there app freemium if they earn above a certain limit from us.)

projects.title: AbinBev Hackathon
projects.about:
Optimus helps businesses visualise their data and get better insights into the factors which are driving sales.
  • Platform to collect data from all over the world to process in real time.
  • Focused on key factors like when to advertise more, which brand need more focused or which item to produce more and when.
  • Great visualization tools for all the data.

achievements.title: Google India Challenge Scholarship Recipient - 2018
achievements.about: Recipient of Google India Challenge Scholarship for the Android Developer track.

achievements.title: 2nd | International Robotic Competition (IRC)
achievements.location: Husky Union Building, University of Washington, Seattle, USA
achievements.about:
My team `Real Steel` designed a rocket assembly process for IRC International 2014 held at Seattle, USA in 2015.
  • Robot aim was to assemble a rocket.
  • Created a black line follower robot which could remove obstacles.
  • The robot picked objects to place them at a launchpad.

blog.name: Design Thinking - Miracle of innovation.
blog.location: Preparing your mind for the birth of innovation. | Medium
blog.about: Innovation and creative problem solving are forces designing the world today, flowing us towards a better future, and Design thinking is at the heart of this innovation and change, like a secret power.

education.level: Bachelor of technology in computer science

courses.name: Writing READMEs
courses.about:
• READMEs are underrated but they are really important for the development of a product.
  • They help in making the code more approachable to the humans.
  • They connect everyone on the team more easily and visually to the code.

courses.name: Design Thinking for Innovation
courses.about:
• Learned about the application of Design Thinking for Innovation.
  • Explored methods to find out new ideas using current data.
  • Possibility - driven, human - centred and option - focused approach.
